qas.question: What area of Mali did conflict arise in January of 2012?

context: In <b5_0>January 2012<b5_0/>, an armed conflict broke out in <a0_0>northern Mali<a0_0/>, which <a1_0><b6_0>Tuareg rebels<b6_0/><a1_0/> took control of by April and declared the secession of <b8_0>a <a2_0>new state<b8_0/>, Azawad<a2_0/>. The conflict was complicated by a military coup that took place in March and later fighting between Tuareg and <b7_0>Islamist rebels<b7_0/>. In response to Islamist territorial gains, the <a3_0>French military<a3_0/> <b9_0>launched Opération Serval<b9_0/> in January 2013. A month later, Malian and French forces recaptured most of the north. <a4_0>Presidential elections<a4_0/> were held on 28 July 2013, with a second round run-off held on 11 August, and legislative elections were held on 24 November and 15 December 2013.
